page.title: 07INDUSTRY: CROPWELL BUTLER
page.content: Local industry thrives but is sadly depleted from its former state. This year the blacksmith has retired after 3 generations, and the "Smithy" may now close. Surviving local craft is joinery & the services now offered are by a Joinery & Fitted Furniture Manufacturer, employing 22, of whom 6 live in the village. There is another small joinery firm who are also builders & plumbers. The general store closed during the 1970's & only a Post Office remains.We have our own service for milk delivery, supplied by a Vale of Belvoir dairy. A small business produces sausages, pies & pastry for home cooking from a production unit in the grounds of a large private house, & a textile design studio has trans- Atlantic connections. Landscape design is carried out by a small firm. We can never again be self-supporting.
